title: Professor Sir Geoffrey Elton was Regius Professor of Modern History at the University of Cambridge from 1983 until his retirement in

He has been a fellow of Clare College, Cambridge since 1954 and between 1967 and 1983 was Professor of English Constitutional History. Following childhood and adolescence in Prague he moved at the age of seventeen to England in

After taking an external degree with the University of London he served for the last years of the Second World War in the East Surrey Regiment, and also in the Intelligence Corps. After the war he obtained a PhD at University College London and following a year teaching at Glasgo ' University, moved to Cambridge in 1949
